channel.title: Datasets on Information Set Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Datasets on Information Set Blog

item.title: WRDS
item.description: WRDS is the go to database to access all finance related datasets. Navigating through WRDS can be challenging for beginners. The first order of business should be to register for WRDS at https://wrds-www.wharton.upenn.edu/ using your university email. Universities usually subscribe to part of the database. Next read the guide here: https://libguides.stanford.edu/library/wrds to have an intially idea of which dataset to look for. Compustat Compustat contains financial data for all publicly traded firms in US.

item.title: Data_at_umn
item.description: University of Minnesota Library also provides access to several datasets. For instance it subscribes to Statista. For a more comprehensive list visit the link below: https://libguides.umn.edu/FindResourcesbyFormat/datasets There is also a specific section related to economics here: https://libguides.umn.edu/econdata A full list of databases that be accessed by UMN Library can be found here: https://libguides.umn.edu/az.php?q= In addition, if one needs access to restricted-use datasets, one can contact the FSRDC at Minnesota. Here is their webpage:

item.title: Data_aggregators
item.description: Below is a website that does exactly what I’m trying to do - list all the datasets that can be useful for research. https://econdata.net/subject-links/ Several of the links in the above website are broken, but still serves as a good guide. Here I list website which aggregate and clean data from different places. 1. IPUMS https://www.ipums.org/ 2. NHGIS https://www.nhgis.org/ 3. Social Explorer https://www.socialexplorer.com/explore-maps

item.title: LBD
item.description: The Longitudinal Business Database (LBD) is restricted use micro data on firms. https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/ces/data/restricted-use-data/longitudinal-business-database.html

item.title: CPS
item.description: The Current Population Survey (CPS) The Annual Social and Economic Supplement (ASEC) to the CPS contains data regarding labor market.

item.title: Comets
item.description: The Connecting Outcome Measures in Entrepreneurship, Technology, and Science (COMETS) database primarily contains patents data and linking it to several other variables. Data Source https://www.kauffman.org/entrepreneurship/research/comets/

item.title: American Community Survey
item.description: Type: Public Use MicroData The American Community Survey (ACS) data on at household and individual level on variables related to demographics and income.
